ch.iserver.ace.net
Interface SessionConnection

All Known Implementing Classes:
SessionConnectionImpl, SessionConnectionWrapper
public interface SessionConnection

A SessionConnection is a network layer interface abstracting the concept of a connection to the session represented by this object. SessionConnections are only used by participants and not by the owner of the session (a different mechanism is used for published sessions).

Method Summary
 int getParticipantId()
          Gets the participant id of the local user.
 boolean isAlive()
          Determines whether the connection is alive.
 void leave()
          Leave the session.
 void sendAcknowledge(int siteId, Timestamp timestamp)
          Sends an acknowledge message to the other site.
 void sendCaretUpdateMessage(CaretUpdateMessage message)
          Sends the given caret update to the session.
 void sendRequest(Request request)
          Sends the given request to the session.
 

Method Detail

getParticipantId

int getParticipantId()
Gets the participant id of the local user.

Returns:
the participant id of the local user

isAlive

boolean isAlive()
Determines whether the connection is alive.

Returns:
true iff the session connection is alive

leave

void leave()
Leave the session. After calling this method, the session becomes stale, i.e. it should not be used anymore.

sendRequest

void sendRequest(Request request)
Sends the given request to the session.

Parameters:
request - the request to be sent

sendCaretUpdateMessage

Sends the given caret update to the session.

Parameters:
message - the CaretUpdateMessage to be sent

sendAcknowledge

void sendAcknowledge(int siteId,
                     Timestamp timestamp)
Sends an acknowledge message to the other site.

Parameters:
siteId - the local site id
timestamp - the local timestamp
